notes: Two political activists were shot dead and another injured in the Saleem Khan union council in the Swabi area on the eve of local government elections in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province on May 29.

A clash between two rival groups belonging to the Dahar community in Hafiz Suleman village of Ghotki district left four persons injured on May 29. Area police said that the embattled groups attacked each others with clubs, hatchets and rocks in their long-running dispute over a piece of land.

assoc_actor_1: HDP: Hazara Democratic Party
notes: HDP members protested against the killing of Hazara people in Quetta.
Police forces dispersed a pro-Muslim Brotherhood rally in Talbiyah in Giza on Friday and arrested a number of alleged supporters.
A civilian was tortured and beaten by 8 police personnel, which allegedly led to his death. The policemen were arraigned on charges of manslaughter on 8 September 2015.
Residents of villages in Chitwan staged a protest in May 2015 against thefts and robberies in the area.

Families and relatives of those killed in a gun-attack against Pathans in Mustung protested outside the Civil Hospital in Quetta as they feel the government has failed to provide protection towards Pakistani citizens
Activists from PTI and JI were sitting discussing election campaign strategies in an election office when unidentified men driving by in motorcycles fired upon them in Swabi, killing both.
Childrens rights activists protest outside the George Magistrates Court where a prominent local dentist appeared in connection with the alleged sexual assault of a 12-year-old boy.

Security measures: In Bugabira, there is a growing cause of tension due to stones being thrown at roofs of peoples homes; this has caused people to flee. Those going through the Bugabira-Kirundo road are searched by the police.
Some people tried to barricade the Makamba-Rutana road at Kumuyogo with trees and tires. The police dispersed the crowd with a grenade and fired into the air. No injuries reported; 6 arrested.
Security measures: There was an inspection into a teachers house suspected of owning a gun. Nothing was found.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
notes: A stray bullet fired by two Puntland soldiers who were allegedly shooting at each other at a checkpoint in Yalho village (45km S of Bossaso) on 29/05 hit a civilian man. The two soldiers escaped from the scene following the incident and the police are pursuing them. It is not known why the two soldiers were firing at each other.
Coalition airstrikes hit gov. compounds in Bayt Al Faqiah

source: Yemen News Agency SABA; Yemen Data Project
notes: According to Local Source, Saudi warplanes bombed two bridges in Damt district, one links Dalei to Sana'a and the other links Damt with Juban district. 3 citizens were killed and another wounded. Saudi later announced it had bombed the bridge as a military target in order to slow supplies to the Houthi troops who are battling Pro-Hadi tribal militias in the province.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Saudi Arabia (2015-)
source: Yemen News Agency SABA; Yemen Data Project
notes: A child was injured in Nushor area due to explosion of a cluster bomb thrown five days ago by the Saudi warplanes.

Five people were killed in a shelling incident, in Ard Greish and Rabha in Benghazi where a mosque and a school were also hit. At least 11 other were wounded in the attacks. It is not known who fired the shell, but Ansar Al-Sharia and its allies in the Benghazi Revolutionaries' Shoura Council are suspected.
Two Islamist militants were killed while 13 suspects were arrested during a campaign targeting in North Sinai, security sources said Friday [29 May].
2 policemen were killed and one more injured when their van came under gun attack by militants in Dera Ismail Khan. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack

2 military personnel and 5 militants were killed as militants ambushed a security forces vehicle and opened fire in Ghulam Khan, NWA. Security forces responded with fire. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

After launching a search operation for militants who had kidnapped 24 pathans of off a bus in Mustung, security forces were able to retrieve 5 (the only surviving kidnapees) after a severe gunfight with militants. No one has claimed responsibility for the attack but the targeting of Pathans highlights that separatist groups could be involved, while the government suspects indian intelligence to be behind the attack.
Coalition airstrikes hit gov. compounds in Ad Durayhimi

The Martyrs square in the city of Gharyan witnessed a massive demonstration on Friday under the theme 'Victory creates peace'. Participants of the demonstration reiterated support for Fajr Libya (Libya Dawn).
Coalition airstrikes hit transport in Khur Maksar
Coalition airstrikes hit private business in Ash Shaikh Outhman
Coalition airstrikes hit unknown in Craiter district.

Large-scale demonstrations, under the slogan 'the victory of Right leads to Peace', continued Friday in Tripoli, Al-Zaweya and Misrata to give support to the revolutionaries and reject Operation Dignity.
Two PPP workers were killed in a targeted attack in Karachi. There is little information available as to the circumstances of the shooting.
2 PPP members were killed by unidentified assailants in the Malir area of Karachi on May 29.
Two security forces personnel were killed along with 15 militants when TTP militants attacked a check-post in Ghulam Khan area in Dattakhel of North Waziristan.

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCOs various headquarters across the DR-Congos provinces.

A blast near the premises of Qaddafi stadium killed one sub inspector who was on duty at the time. The blast took place during a cricket match between Pakistan and Zimbabwe, in the first international series Pakistan has held in many years.

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCOs various headquarters across the DR-Congos provinces.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: Civilians accused of supporting the former Mashonaland West ruling party provincial chairperson Temba Mliswa, who is running as an independent candidate in the upcoming by-elections, are severely beaten by ZANU-PF activists.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: A Zanu PF member was assaulted by other Zanu PF members after he had been suspended from the provincial structures.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: Zanu-PF youths beat up rivals and disrupting a meeting organised by Temba Mliswa, an ex-Zanu-PF politician running as an independent in the upcoming by-election.

Residents of Clairwood in Durban burn debris and barricade the road to prevent trucks from gaining entry to the area. The residents complain that the trucks have caused extensive damage to properties in the area.
Armed men assassinated local elected leader Mohamedou el Maouloud Ag Mohamedoun about 100km from Timbuktu.

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: Daily fighting at multiple locations took place between 26-29th of May between local pastoralists and Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries occurred along the Ethiopia-Somali border. Among the villages affected by the Liyu Police offensive are Laba Baar, Isma Dhaqa, Balli dhiig and Sariiro. These villages all lie along Galgadud border. The Givernor of Galgadud region Mr. Hussein Ali Wehliye (Cirfo) appealed to the Federal Government of Somalia to take action against the invasion of the Ethiopian Liyu Police forces. More than fifty people including civilians were killed.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
notes: A rocket fired from a plateau overlooking Gao fell on the nearby MINUSMA camp, causing no casualties.
A clash between two groups of the Chachar community over a land dispute broke out in the Ghotki area on May 29.
Unidentified Armed gunmen kidnapped two-dozen pathans from a bus bound from Mastung, Balochistan to Karachi. They later killed 19 of them and left their bodies in the wilderness

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCOs various headquarters across the DR-Congos provinces.
Despite a heavy police presence throughout Bujumbura, small protests took place in the Kanyosha, Nyakabiga, and Kinanira neighbourhoods.
Despite a heavy police presence throughout Bujumbura, small protests took place in the Kanyosha, Nyakabiga, and Kinanira neighbourhoods.
Despite a heavy police presence throughout Bujumbura, hundreds protested in Cibitoke and Butere.
A grenade exploded in Bujumburas city center, and the attacker was arrested shortly after. No injuries were reported.
On 29 May 2015, small demonstrations took place in the Kanyosha, Nyakabiga, and Kinanira neighbourhoods despite a heavy police presence throughout Bujumbura.
Despite a heavy police presence throughout Bujumbura, hundreds protested in Cibitoke and Butere.
Protests

On 29 May 2015, hundreds of mud disaster's victims held a peaceful protest in Porong district, Sidoarjo regency, East Java province, commemorating eight years of the disaster caused by a mining company. They demanded the promised compensation.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross; Aid Workers (International); Health Workers (International); Civilians (International)
source: HRW; Al Motamar; Yemen Data Project
notes: On 29 May 2015, a coalition airstrike on Hajja City resulted into the death of three civilians and in the injury of at least 17 others. An ICRC aid worker was later announced to have died in the event.

assoc_actor_1: Refugees/IDPs (Pakistan)
notes: On 29 May 2015, hundreds of Kashmiri refugees from camps surrounding Muzaffarabad staged a protest demonstration in the city in support of their demands for relief.

assoc_actor_1: FBR: Betawi Brotherhood Forum
notes: On 29 May 2015, hundreds of members of FBR: Betawi Rempug Forum rioted at a mall in North Jakarta City, Jakarta province by trying to destroy the mall. They clashed with the mall's security. The reason for the riot was unknown.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Beled Xawo District administration forces clashed with KDF forces in Beled Xawo over a border dispute on the 29/05. The clash started when Kenyan forces started destroying buildings on the Somali and Kenya border, Kenyan government is seemingly trying to construct a wall on the border between Somalia and Kenya starting from Mandera. The two sides exchanged a brief gunfire and a gun was taken from KDF side though it was returned to them after reconciliatory talks between two sides. No casualties were reported.

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCOs various headquarters across the DR-Congos provinces.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: After a police officer allegedly caused a motorcycle-taxi driver to fall of his bike, causing him serious injuries, a crowd believing the driver to be dead beat up the policemen responsible, putting at least one of them in the hospital. They then pursued other police, and forced them off the streets for 48 hours.

source: Deep South Watch (CSCD); Kom Chad Luek
notes: On 29 May 2015, four soldiers, part of a team providing security to teachers of Ban Bor Ngor School in Bo Ngo village, Moo 4, tambon Bo-Ngo, Ra-Ngae district, Narathiwat province were injured while patrolling the area when a hidden bomb, presumably planted by Malay Muslim separatists, was detonated remotely. Two students were also injured by the blast.

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCOs various headquarters across the DR-Congos provinces.
Youths pelt dignitaries with stones during the inauguration of Gov. Nasir El-Rufa'i of Kaduna State. Police dispersed the crowd, no injuries reported.

An angry mob attacked a presumed homosexual young man but were stopped by a policeman. One month later, a video of the incident was made public and police arrested two men suspected of participating in the attack.

Large-scale demonstrations, under the slogan 'the victory of Right leads to Peace', continued Friday in Tripoli, Al-Zaweya and Misrata to give support to the revolutionaries and reject Operation Dignity.

Large-scale demonstrations, under the slogan 'the victory of Right leads to Peace', continued Friday in Tripoli, Al-Zaweya and Misrata to give support to the revolutionaries and reject Operation Dignity.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Yemen (2015-2017) Houthi-Saleh - Special Security Forces
notes: AFP reported that at least 40 rebels were killed and dozens were wounded in air strikes and fighting for the city of Aden. Most of the clashes and strikes took place just north of the city.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Yemen (2015-2017) Houthi-Saleh - Special Security Forces
notes: Aden Mall, the largest and most popular mall in Aden, was hit by Houthi forces on Thursday, and pictures of destroyed shops went viral on social media.

assoc_actor_1: Operation Restoring Hope
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Yemen (2015-2017) Houthi-Saleh - Special Security Forces
notes: Heavy clashes between the Southern Resistance and Houthi militants broke near the airport on Friday. At least 4 from the Southern Resistance and 15 from Houthi forces backed up by the Ex President Ali Abdulla Saleh were killed in the clashes and tens have been reported injured.

assoc_actor_1: Operation Restoring Hope
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Yemen (2015-2017) Houthi-Saleh - Special Security Forces
notes: AFP reported that at least 40 rebels were killed and dozens were wounded in air strikes and fighting for the city of Aden. Most of the clashes and strikes took place just north of the city. They added that 19 civilians and pro Hadi fighters had been confirmed dead by medical officials. Fatalities spread throughout 2 airstrikes and battles in the city.

source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 29 May 2015, clashes reportedly erupted between Houthi forces and Islah-affiliated tribesmen in Al-Ashah district after the tribesmen ambushed several Houthis, injuring at least two of them.

actor2: AQAP: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
source: Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: Houthi-Saleh forces burned a weapon store belong to Al Qaeda in Lahj province, adding that the many militants of the group were killed in the operation. Further details are unclear. In a separate event two bombs were defuse of two improvised explosive devices (IED) planted by Al Qaeda elements in Habban district Lahj province.

assoc_actor_1: Al Islah Party; Operation Restoring Hope
source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 29 May 2015, clashes reportedly erupted between Houthi-Saleh forces and Islah-affiliated tribesmen in the Popular Resistance in Al-Himmah Al-Sawdaa and Al-Jafinah areas in the outskirts of Marib city. At least two were killed. Fatalities split up across three events.

source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: Coalition airstrikes reportedly hit a residential area in Al-Ashraf area of Majzar district, killing four.

assoc_actor_1: Al Islah Party; Operation Restoring Hope
source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 29 May 2015, clashes reportedly erupted between Houthi-Saleh forces and Islah-affiliated tribesmen in the Popular Resistance in Ar Rawdah, Al-Himmah Al-Sawda'a and Al-Jafinah areas in the outskirts of Marib city. At least two were killed. Fatalities split up across three events.

Clashes reportedly erupted between Houthi-Saleh forces and local tribesmen in the outskirts of Ataq city, killing and injuring several people. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

assoc_actor_1: Al Islah Party; Militia (Hamud Said al Mikhlafi)
notes: On 29 May 2015, clashes reportedly erupted between Houthi-Saleh forces and Popular Resistance forces in Kalabah area of Taiz city, killing at least one person and causing material damages. Violent clashes were also reported in Revolution area, Al-Hadid, Al-Jumhouri, Al-Manakh and Jabal Jarrah, with several people reported killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10 and split across five events.

actor1: AQAP: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
notes: On 29 May 2015, Ansar al Sharia took credit for VBIED attack targeting al Houthi militants in Shaqra.
An unidentified suicide bomber attacks a wedding in Tashon Alade on 29/05, killing six guests.
About 20 Shia worshippers were injured when a armed group attacked a mosque in Ruguji, Kafur LGA of Katsina State. The reason for the attack was not known.
The resumption of activities by the True Gold mining activity led to riots in Namissiguima. 4 protesters and 3 security forces were injured, a security vehicle was damaged, and 15 were arrested.

source: 26 September News; Al Motamar; Yemen Data Project
notes: Coalition airstrikes reportedly targeted the Scientific Centre in Dar Al-Sharif area of Jihanah district, killing one and injuring 25.

source: 26 September News; Mwatana; Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: On 29 May 2015, coalition airstrikes reportedly hit the Houthi-occupied Ghadran health center (Bani Hushaysh, Sanaa) which was still under construction at that time. Some people in the area warned Houthis through social media that the center would be attacked if they did not leave, but they refused to vacate it. The attack killed eight people, including a child, and injured thirteen others.
Coalition airstrikes hit institute in Al Haymah Al Kharijiyah

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: On 29 May 2015, in Sirte, 2 Airstrikes by helicopter were carried out by Military Forces of Libya. No fatalities have been reported.

Residents of Marikana informal settlement riot and destroy houses near the settlement. The act prompts retaliation by residents of Lower Crossroads who, in turn, set ablaze a shack of the man they accused of being behind the attacks. Service-derlivery have been ongoing in the Marikana informal settlement area.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Bangladesh)
notes: Students staged a protest in Dhaka on 29 May 2015 against a recent rape incident in the city.

assoc_actor_1: Journalists (Pakistan)
notes: A protest demonstration was recorded by the local journalists of Commissioner Hyderabad on May 29.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Pakistan)
notes: Three days of protests against the non-payment of health allowance of Paramedical staff of Jinnah Hospital in Karachi were held between May 28-30.
On 29 May 2015, assailants, presumably Malay Muslim Separatists, shot and killed a male civilian and wounded his wife in Santi 2 village, Moo 6, tambon Mae Wat, Than To district of Yala, Thailand.

assoc_actor_1: Digil-Gelledi Sub-Clan Militia (Somalia)
notes: Striking workers, supported by the CWU, barricade the entrance to MTNs head office and burn debris. The workers are striking over neglect and alleged racial abuse by management. The rioters clash with police who use tear gas and rubber bullets.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: At least seven Libyan soldiers were killed and 10 others injured in an attack by militants affiliated with Islamic State (IS, formerly known as ISIS/ISIL) near the city of Darnah. The Islamic State militants targeted a position of forces loyal to the Libyan army chief Khalifah Haftar in Lamludah, west of Darnah.
Suspected Boko Haram target a wedding in Tashon Alade with a suicide blast. Six deaths reported.

source: Al Arabiya; Xinhua; Yemen Data Project
notes: On 29 May 2015, an IS militant detonated a suicide vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (SVBIED) near a Shia mosque in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, killing four people.
Chadian military planes targeted Boko haram positions on Lake Chad and destroyed food, fuel, and munitions belonging to the insurgents.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Saudi Arabia (2015-)
source: Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: One person was killed and two others injured when Saudi warplanes attacked an oil tanker at the al-Majbar checkpoint in Hardh district of Hajjah province.

source: Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: The Saudi-led coalition launched more than 20 air strikes on Malahedh area in Dhaher district in Sa'ada causing damage in shops, residential buildings and governmental facilities, including a health unit.

source: 26 September News; Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: On 29 May 2015, Houthi-Saleh forces reportedly shelled several Saudi military sites in Jaizan governorate, including in Al-Hajr, Al-Amod, Al-Dukhan and Al-Hajfaa'a military camp. ACLED uses a Yemeni location close to the border to record events between pro-Houthi and anti-Houthi troops where the location reported within 20km of the border in Saudi Arabia has an unclear geoprecision.

source: 26 September News; Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: On 29 May 2015, Houthi-Saleh forces reportedly shelled several Saudi military sites in Jaizan governorate, including in Al-Hajr, Al-Amod, Al-Dukhan and Al-Hajfaaa military camp. *ACLED defaults to coding the event on the Yemeni side when the source describes a large area along the Saudi-Yemeni border.

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCOs various headquarters across the DR-Congos provinces.

assoc_actor_1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: Eight people were killed, including three children in a rocket attack in the Birkah district of Benghazi. Shelling hit a park where children were playing as well as a school and other civilian areas. Five people were also seriously wounded. Islamist militants were blamed for the attack.

source: AP; Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: Security officials said the city of Saeed fell into the hands of the Houthis after some local tribal sheikhs and military leaders accepted money and weapons to facilitate their entry into the area. They say dozens of fighters were killed in the two-day long battle, along with six civilians. Fatalities split up between two events.
